data.name: "SuperDude!" Barrel-Aged Russian Imperial Stout
data.description: Dude Abide no More! Aging for six months in a Big Bottom Whiskey Barrel, this dark full-bodied stout absorbed maximum amounts of bourbon character and flavor. Rich and smooth, the “SuperDude!” is our best stout yet.

style.name: Wood- and Barrel-Aged Strong Beer
style.description: Any strong classic style or unique, experimental style of beer can be wood or barrel-aged for a period of time in a wooden barrel or in contact with wood. This beer is aged with the intention of imparting the particularly unique character of the wood and/or what has previously been in the barrel. New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and unique wood character but wood aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. Ultimately a balance of flavor, aroma and mouthfeel are sought with the marriage of new beer with wood and/or barrel flavors. Primary character of the beer style may or may not be apparent. Sour wood-aged beer of any color is outlined in other categories. Beers in this style may or may not have Brettanomyces character. The brewer must explain the special nature of the beer to allow for accurate judging. Comments could include: type of wood used (new or old, oak or other wood type), type of barrel used (new, port/ whiskey/ wine/ sherry/ other), base beer style or achieved character. Beer entries not accompanied by this information will be at a disadvantage during judging.

breweries.name: Vertigo Brewing
breweries.description:
The early seeds of Vertigo Brewing were sown back in 1995 when Mike Haines and Mike Kinion began experimenting with brewing at U-Brew in Tigard, Oregon. But what began as a light hobby soon developed into a deep passion. They quickly outgrew the offerings of U-Brew and expanded their operation into a homebrew setup. Fifteen years later, the two Mikes have a lot of batches, awards, and experience under their belts. Starting in May of 2008, Vertigo Brewing was christened a fully-licensed brewery in a Hillsboro warehouse. 
Vertigo Brewing is currently operating a one barrel system, producing eight to ten barrels a month. But as demand takes off, the two Mikes are eagerly looking forward to an expanded business operation. Vertigo prides itself on producing a unique blend of beer offerings that manage to stand out in the beer-saturated market of the Northwest.

data.name: (512) Whiskey Barrel Double Pecan Porter
data.description: (512) Double Pecan Porter is a robust porter accented by locally grown roasted pecans and subtly enhanced by aging in recently emptied oak whiskey barrels. For the first ever bottling, only one 200L barrel was bottled. Notes of chocolate, coffee and pecan marry with the subtle flavors of vanilla and whiskey to make this a wonderful winter warmer worth sharing and savoring. We sincerely hope you enjoy every sip.

breweries.name: (512) Brewing Company
breweries.description: (512) Brewing is a micro-brewery located in the heart of Austin, brewing for the community using as many local, domestic and organic ingredients as possible. We use USDA organic 2-row base malt because it's the right thing to do. We self distribute because we can and we're draft only to keep the product fresh and to reduce disposable packaging. You can taste the passion in our products and we appreciate all our local support.

data.name: 2011 Grand Crüe
data.description:
2011 Grand Crüe (8.8% ABV) is a unique blend of Bourbon Barrel Aged Full Throttle Double IPA, Barleywine and fresh Frye's Leap IPA. This beer is complex from both the malty backbone of the Full Throttle and Barleywine and the assertive hoppiness of Frye's Leap.

2011 Grand Crüe is a limited release, available starting July 22, 2011 while supplies last on draft and in 22oz bombers to go at all Sebago locations and select beer retailers throughout Maine.

breweries.name: Sebago Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Sebago Brewing Company we brew our beers from all malt. We use American grown 2-Row, caramel, chocolate, black, roasted barley and Munich malts from Briess Malting Company. Our grain silo holds 50,000 lbs. of American 2-Row Pale malt. We purchase our grain by the truckload and the bulk grain is blown into the silo from the grain truck. We use 75-80% of this grain in all of our beers. Then we measure our specialty malts into the mill. At this point we crush the malt so that the husk's are cracked open and the "meat" of the grain is exposed.

data.name: 20th Anniversary
data.description: 20th Anniversary, Brick Mason Series #7, is an Imperial Stout aged in bourbon barrels. We are celebrating our milestone anniversary with a milestone beer that will be the strongest beer in brewery’s history. Rich dark chocolate and roasted coffee flavors are balanced by sweet caramel malts. Bourbon barrels provide big bourbon notes supported by flavors of oak and vanilla. This beer commemorates Red Brick Brewing Company’s 20 year brewing tradition. And while we’re focused on the future, we’ll never forget our humble beginnings.

breweries.name: Red Brick Brewing Company
breweries.description:
As the southeast's oldest brewery, Red Brick recently celebrated their 20th Anniversary. This milestone not only exemplifies their continuing commitment to amazing craft beer, but also signals a shift in focus for the brewery towards more innovative recipes and concepts.

Headed up by a small group of impassioned beer lovers including head brewer Garett Lockhart, Red Brick is determined to lead the charge in the south, putting out excellent beers such as "Hoplanta" IPA and the upcoming winter release "Sacred Cow" chai milk stout. They also take time to push the limits of brewing with the "Brick Mason" series, which the staff sees as their continuing masterpiece. Highlights from this series include "The Lost Years" old ale, "Black-Eye Rye" American black ale, and the most recent release "20th Anniversary", a 10% Imperial stout that was aged in Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels. Early accolades have already compared it to the hallowed KBS.

The future keeps looking brighter and brighter for this brewery, and the next couple years will see them growing and experimenting with diverse styles, collaborating with fellow breweries, implementing a new barrel program, and continuing to raise the bar for themselves in all aspects. After all, craft beer isn't just a product; it's a journey.

breweries.name: Excel Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Excel Brewing Company runs a 20 BBL brewhouse. The brewery is a division of Excel Bottling Company. Once up and running, we will offer co-packing for the St. Louis regional craft beers.

Excel Bottling Company was founded in 1936 by the Meier Family. The company bottles more than 10 flavors of old-fashioned sodas including “Ski” soda. Each soda flavor is manufactured using pure cane sugar and most often packaged in eco-friendly, returnable glass bottles. In 2012, Excel Bottling Company embarked on a new bottling venture in the craft beer business serving Illinois and Missouri. Excel Bottling Company is headquartered in Breese, Ill. Visit www.excelbrewing.com for more information.

data.name: 6th Anniversary Barrel-aged Rye Wine
data.description: This Barrel-Aged Rye Wine was brewed to celebrate our sixth year of brewing. Our three brewers each brewed their own recipe, then blended them in the same fermentation tank. We then aged the beer in a mix of Bourbon and Rye-Whiskey barrels. The end result is an uniquely spicy, complex ale with a solid barrel influence.

data.name: 8th Anniversary Ale
data.description: To celebrate our eighth anniversary, we’ve blended three contrasting Bourbon barrel-aged ales: an Imperial Stout, Smoked Doppelbock, and a Belgian Dark Strong Ale with cherries and plums. We then added vanilla beans to the final blend which creates an extra layer of complexity and a smooth symmetry.

data.name: American Wild
data.description: Originally a barley wine that was manipulated into an American Wild (using other yeast or bacteria in the beer).  This brew was made back in December of 2014, had a lot of potential but still too young.  The George Dickle barrel opened up so it was, naturally, a perfect contender to age.  Along the aging process we decided to add a little brettanomyces to ‘funk’ it up.  The nose has tropical fruit, with noticeable alcohol, along with nice sweet dark fruits and cherries.  The flavor is a little spicy from the high alcohol along with a nice cherry note.  In the background is a nice brown sugar flavor from the aging.  The barrel is noticeable but not over the top.  Prost!

breweries.name: Noble Ale Works
breweries.description:
Noble Ale Works is a microbrewery located in Anaheim, California at the Stadium Plaza Business Park in the Platinum Triangle. We are conveniently located between the Angels Stadium and the Honda Center.
 
Our goal is to create and maintain high quality full flavored craft brews for those who can handle it. "We are not here to convert light or non-beer drinkers; our beer is for people that already appreciate craft beer" We will never skimp on quality or freshness of ingredients, so that we can maintain the high profile flavor of brews that we at Noble care about.

data.name: Barrel Aged AKA
data.description: AKA stands for Al and Kathy, Bill’s parents. The recipe for this beer is inspired by both English Strong Ales and Scotch Wee Heavy ales. Brewed from an American perspective, this beer is a rich malty brew with soft whiskey barrel notes. Medium bodied with a smooth finish. A special beer in honor of special parents.

data.name: Barrel Aged Black Saddle
data.description: Black Saddle Bourbon Barrel Aged Stout is a complex beer that is definitely a sipper.  In Black Saddle BBA Stout you'll find a multitude of flavors - dark malts, Bourbon, chocolate, dark fruits and more.  Before taking that first sip, allow the aroma to envelope you - amazing.  Be sure to serve it in a glass that will do it justice - a snifter is preferred.  13.3% ABV.

breweries.name: Crystal Springs Brewing Co
breweries.description: We make good beer, plain and simple. If you are looking for unique, small batch beers painstakingly created under the watchful eyes and hands of our brew master, look no further. You have found something unique to pour into your favorite glass. Our brewery is named after the original Crystal Springs Brewing and Ice Company, founded in 1875 in Boulder, Colorado. We brew craft beer you must try. Each of our beers begin with a simple theme: to create memorable beers - ones that our customers will savor and want to share with close friends. Drinking great beer is our aspiration, making great beer is our passion.

breweries.name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
breweries.description:
Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.

We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

data.name: BARREL AGED BRRRBON ’12
data.description: THIS SMOOTH WINTER WARMER COMBINES A RICH MALTY SWEETNESS WITH COMPLEX OAK, VANILLA, AND CARAMEL CHARACTERS THAT WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP AS THE BEER AGES.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

data.name: Barrel Aged Dubbel
data.description: Our barrel aged version of our Magella. A Belgian dark strong ale aged in Catoctin Creek rye whiskey and Jack Daniels barrels for 6 months. Big on flavors with notes of dried fruits, wood, vanilla, spice and a bit of Belgian flair. Age this beer or enjoy fresh.

breweries.name: Parkway Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Hidden in Salem’s industrial corridor of Kessler Mill Road, Parkway Brewing is poised to breathe new life into this forgotten thouroughfare by Mason Creek. With easy access from the Hanging Rock Battlefield Trail, Interstate 81, East Main Street and Routes 311 and 419, everyone can easily find their way to the rivers of tasty goodness we’ll be pouring on site! Come by on for a flight & a look around. And of course, you’ll want to take home a refillable Growler as a mouth-watering treat for the family or friends. Or you might just want to drink it all yourself!

We have loads of fun events planned, so check back here often. Bands, Food Trucks, Belly Dancing, "Body By Parkway Runners Club," Craft Nights, Cornhole Tourneys, you name it, it can happen HERE. You never know what you’ll find going on at Parkway Brewing, but fun will reign, so stop by & check us out. Only one rule: No Bad Vibes!

data.name: Barrel Aged First Descent
data.description: Amber color, slight haze from oak aging.  5 months of whiskey barrel aging adds a bright caramel & vanilla toasted oak character to the rich caramel malt aromas.  On the palate the caramel character from the malt has been enhanced by the caramel character of the toasted oak, still showing the strong vanilla character and a slightly drier finish.  The warming of the high alcohol content can be felt but is soft and melds nicely with the fruity and spicy flavors.

breweries.name: Great Divide Brewing Company
breweries.description:
These beers have landed an impressive amount of acclaim: Great Divide beers have earned 18 Great American Beer Festival medals and 5 World Beer Cup awards. Great Divide was also ranked 8th in Ratebeer.com’s 2010 “The Best Brewers in the World” and was ranked 7th in Beer Advocate’s 2009 “All-Time Top Breweries on Planet Earth.”

But why take their word for it? Crack open a bottle and decide for yourself.

data.name: Barrel Aged Jean-Claude Van Damn!
data.description: We've gone and done the impossible - we made Jean-Claude Van Damn! even more badass. We took our Belgian Dark Strong ale and aged it in Archery Summit Pinot Noir barrels for four months. The dark fruit notes are still present, but now they're complemented by hints of vanilla, oak, and even a little leather. JCVD is tough, and this beer will be even tougher to find. Get it while you can.

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

breweries.name: Southern Prohibition Brewing
breweries.description: Southern Prohibition Brewing launched in April of 2013 with two simple goals: brew great beer and help make Mississippi a great place to live. Our 22,000 sq. ft. warehouse was a furniture showroom when originally constructed in 1941. After some renovations, the microbrewery in Downtown Hattiesburg houses a 20 barrel brewhouse. With three 60 barrel and four 40 barrel fermenters, Southern Prohibition currently has the capacity to produce 5,000 barrels a year.

data.name: Barrel Aged Mississippi Fire Ant
data.description: This imperial red ale has a huge malt presence only to be out shined by its hop additions. Dark mahogany red with a nice fluffy head, Fire Ant showcases roasted and toasted caramel notes layered between spicy, herbal and fruity hops.

breweries.name: Hoppin' Frog Brewery
breweries.description:
Hoppin’ Frog is a small, hands-on brewery making very flavorful beers in the most flavorful beer styles. We brew high quality beers with an uncompromising focus on detail, from the ingredient selection to the brewing process. A specially designed JV Northwest brewing system creates more flavorful beers by allowing more barley to be used in the brewing process.  We also use a special bottling machine that keeps the beer fresher, and extends storage times compared to other conventional microbrewery bottling machines. This is very beneficial to retain all the character of these flavorful styles of beer.

Hoppin’ Frog is the concept of owner and established brewmaster Fred Karm, who has designed and produced more award-winning beers than any other professional brewer in Ohio since 2000. All of these awards were won at the 2 most prestigious contests in the world, including the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. Mr. Karm has been a brewer of specialty beers since 1994, a life-long Akron, Ohio resident, and is a graduate of the University Of Akron.

data.name: Barrel Aged Ragana
data.description: Baltic Porters were originally brewed for the long trip from England to the Baltic region. Răgana (Lithuanian for witch) is deep, dark and full of complex flavors. Full bodied with chocolate, coffee and a slight smokiness, English hops round out this wicked ale, adding a clean finish thanks to a colder fermentation.

data.name: Barrel Aged Tripel
data.description:
2009 – Our Tripel aged in a barrel for an extended period of time. Belgian esters and light fruit notes meld with a smooth vanilla and oak to create a rich smooth sipping beer. Our first batch rings in at 11.65%, medium bodied with a smooth finish.

2010 – Aged in Pinot Noir and Merlot barrels. Each of the seven barrels we used are from the same vintage of wine.

Unlike wine makers, we did not blend the contents from each barrel together. Rather choosing to let the subtle and unique differences from each barrel stand on their own.

Each barrel is recognized on the label as batch PN1 through PN6, and M1. Meaning Pinot Noir barrel 1 through Pinot Noir barrel 6 and Merlot barrel 1.

Pinot Noir barrels 1 through 3 have a nice soft fruit note. Barrels 4 through 6 have a softer wine note and more of a sharp oak flavor from the barrel. The Merlot barrel has a rich, sharp Merlot note, soften by our Tripel, with hints of oak.

breweries.description:
Left Coast Brewing Company was formed in 2004 with a capacity of 5,500 bbls.  Since then, we have expanded our operation to 13,000 bbls with our current tanks.  Our main focus for the Left Coast are Hoppy Beers, Stouts, and German Lagers. We do however add new styles as part of our seasonal program and have one Belgian tripel ale.

We brew, bottle and keg everything in house at our San Clemente facility and our team is dedicated to the perfection of our product.

This beer is aged with the intention of imparting the particularly unique character of the wood and/or what has previously been in the barrel. New wood character can be characterized as a complex blend of vanillin and unique wood character but wood aged is not necessarily synonymous with imparting wood-flavors. Used sherry, rum, bourbon, scotch, port, wine and other barrels are often used, imparting complexity and uniqueness to beer. breweries.name: DC Brau Brewing Company
breweries.description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.

data.name: Barrel-Aged HopAnomaly
data.description:
An artful creation which began with our Hop God Belgian-Style IPA, enhanced by a 6 month maturation in French Oak Chardonnay Barrels. This version of Hop God is a
fascinating, big, bold Belgian-style Tripel hopped in very high amounts to concentrate
citrus, grapefruit and floral aromatics in the nose. The addition of Chardonnay barrel
aging adds further dimension and oak tannins to an already wonderfully complex Ale - bringing to mind tropical fruits and peach. We know of nothing that compares - enjoy! 

Formerly Known as Barrel Aged HopGod

breweries.name: Portland Brewing
breweries.description:
The Brewery: At our brewery, you'll find a peculiar mix of overly obsessive individuals passionately creating something the civilized world simply can't live without: Great Beer. Without their valiant efforts, our world would slip into darkness.

The Beer: We seek to brew the very best craft beer out of Portland. With our unique touches on classic styles and our constant efforts to innovate and lead craft brewing into new, uncharted territories, even the most discerning palates will find something they love. Two year-round offerings, four seasonals and a series of four big-bottle beers will make sure of that.

The City: Considered to be the epicenter of the American craft brewing resurgence, Portland, Oregon is home to more breweries than any other city in America. Portland Brewing was one of the first craft brewers in the city and created Portland’s original Amber Ale. A favorite throughout the years, when Portlander’s say “Gimme a Mac’s” it’s understood they want the crisp, distinct flavor that MacTarnahan’s Amber Ale is known for.

data.name: Big LeBarrelski
data.description: A Russian Imperial Milk Stout brewed with coffee from the fine Roasters at Tweed Coffee Roasters and aged in a blend of Virgin Oak Barrels and Jim Beam Bourbon Barrels. The barrel aging process takes place for 6 months and gives the beers strong notes of vanilla, almond, toffee, tannin… and of course bourbon. Our brewers sample each barrel and using their expertise and finely honed palates develop the yearly blend for this beer. Every vintage is unique so you do not want to miss the chance to try out this rare treat... after all it is how the Dude Imbibes.

breweries.name: Pinthouse Pizza
breweries.description: Pinthouse Pizza is a craft brewpub serving Austin's finest pizza and world class beers. The Pinthouse Pizza brewing style is a hop-forward, American-fusion style that emphasizes the flavor and aroma of the beloved hop flower without the traditional bitterness associated with hoppy beers. We are proud to be working with some of the best hop growers in the country and are excited to be showcasing these flavor profiles.

breweries.name: Shmaltz Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Shmaltz Brewing Company is an American craft brewing company that brews He'brew Beer. Shmaltz is known for blurring beer styles and using puns, art, history, and pop culture in every aspect of its products. 

Founded as the first and still only "Jewish-celebration beer," proprietor Jeremy Cowan established the company in San Francisco in 1996 with the first 100 cases of He’brew Beer hand bottled and delivered throughout the Bay Area in his Grandmother’s Volvo. He’brew now sells across 35 states, through 40 wholesalers and nearly 5,000 retailers. 

After 17 years of being an outspoken cheerleader for contract brewing, Shmaltz recently broke with tradition and opened its own New York State production brewery in Clifton Park, NY, 10 minutes north of Albany’s capital district. Shmaltz’s new home boasts a 50-barrel brewhouse with 30,000 barrels of annual capacity. The new brewery packages 12 and 22 ounce bottles and kegs of their diverse core and seasonal favorites, and hosts fans and beer tourists in their new tasting room for tours, barrel-aged previews, and special releases.

data.name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Arrogant Bastard
data.description: I didn't give you permission to pick me up, let alone drink me. Being groped as you mutter to yourself taxes my patience. While I am a master of social complexities and articulate thought, clearly you are not. I embody the pinnacle of intellectual and artistic fulfillment, while you bring the baggage of preconceived notions, which only distract. Yet, I'll give you one chance: Aspire to free your mind. Use a crowbar if you must. Approach me with openness, unsullied by your irrelevant "life experience," or leave me alone. No, you don't have to put up with this. Go tweet your precious insights about me. Thrill yourself by imagining your three or 30,000 followers hanging on your every word. OMG, they're waiting to read the thought you just had. Now close your mouth and either set me down or do your worst. What's that? You're going to drink a fizzy yellow beer out of spite? Self-flagellate all you like, tiger. Proclaim your unworthiness to whoever will listen.

breweries.name: Stone Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing Co. is the 10th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list nine times, and has been called the “All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth” by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. The multi-faceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently own and operate facilities in Berlin, Germany and also has plans to open operations east of the Mississippi. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.

data.name: Bourbon Barrel American Imperial Stout
data.description: Thick and black as motor oil, this style has a more pronounced hop presence than its cousin, the Russian Imperial Stout. Herbal hop notes lightly cut through aromas of luscious black currants, brown sugar, and rich, dark chocolate. Big and bold on the palate, the roasty, chewy flavors are nuanced with a slight fruitiness and just the right amount of bitterness, both from the roasted malt and the hops. Several months aging in spent Bourbon barrels imparts toasty vanilla and coconut notes, while allowing the beer to mellow out into a smooth fireside sipper.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Bourbon Barrel BarleyWine
data.description: English Style Barleywine Aged in a Woodford Reserve Barrel.  It is big, strong, and full of flavor.  This beer is ruby brown in color and is dominated by its aggressive bourbon flavors, with large vanilla and oak notes.  Sweet malt backbone of fig, raisin, and sherry.  Low hop profile lets the malt and barrel sing.
data.foodPairings: Great aperitif by itself or with some blue cheese.

breweries.name: The ChopHouse & Brewery
breweries.description: As a popular gathering place, our pride is in serving American steakhouse classics, paired with the city’s finest handcrafted beers brewed on site. But we are much more than a steakhouse, offering a great experience at an affordable price, with hand-cut chops, fresh seafood and an extensive wine list, all in a unique turn of the century bank transformed into one of Washington’s hot spots.

data.description: Pours brown with very little head. The aroma is caramel malt, nutty, bourbon, vanilla and oak. The flavor is a wonderful blend of sweet caramel, fresh nuts, bourbon, vanilla, wood and light cherry notes.

breweries.name: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery
breweries.description: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery prides itself in creating neo-traditional handcrafted artisan ales. Inside each pint, a fusion of American craft brewing creativity and historically sound techniques await your palate. A marriage of exploration and tradition guaranteed to cure whatever ales you!

data.name: Bourbon Barrel Dark Apparition
data.description: This hauntingly good brew in your hand is rife with dark complexities. Eleven malts were used to create deep flavors of coffee, chocolate, caramel, and molasses. A hint of bitterness and herbal character from carefully selected American hops help support the monolithic maltiness of Dark Apparition. After a month of conditioning in stainless steel, the beer was transferred into bourbon barrels. For 8 months, Dark Apparition waited patiently in oak barrels until the time was right to spring forth with its ghostly gusto. A truly decadent brew that is intended to be poured into your favorite snifter and given time to warm up from its dark and cold resting place. Be aware when in the presence of Dark Apparition ’cause this ghost is a creeper.

data.name: Bourbon Barrel Imperial Stout
data.description: this Bourbon Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout is offered to you in the truest sense of craftsmanship.  We take pride in producing a beer that we savor and look forward to with great anticipation each year.  The incredibly complex depth of flavors produced during the barrel-aging process cannot be created any other way.  Each barrel is tested to assess its worthiness and we exclude barrels that don't make the cut.  In the end, we have created a unique beer that we hope you enjoy as much as we do.
data.foodPairings: Aged gouda, caramel, bleu cheese stuffed dates, goose or duck with cherry sauce.

data.name: Bourbon Barrel Temptress
data.description:
Everything you love about our Imperial Milk Stout, but boozier and nicely-aged. One could go so far as saying Bourbon Barrel Temptress is the "cougar" of milk stouts.

Hints of vanilla, oak, toffee, caramel, and roasted coffee intertwine for a boozy, dangerously smooth treat. Take your time with her and she'll reward you.
data.foodPairings: English toffee, chocolate lave cake, lust

breweries.name: Lakewood Brewing Company
breweries.description:
From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers, perfect for whichever neighborhood you call home.
Pay us a visit in our taproom and beer garden. Brewery tours are offered on the weekends and free to the public. Schol!
